alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Harris; Marion; Meriwether; Muscogee; Schley; Talbot; Taylor; Troup; Webster (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 2:59PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Meriwether, Marion, northeastern Muscogee, northeastern Chattahoochee, northeastern Webster, southeastern Troup, Schley, Talbot, western Taylor and eastern Harris Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 259 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Pine Mountain to Waverly Hall to near Brantley to Draneville, and moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Buena Vista, Ellaville, Hamilton, Talbotton, Greenville, Manchester, Pine Mountain, Woodbury, Waverly Hall, Warm Springs, Woodland, Junction City, Geneva, Upatoi, Putnam, Brantley, Shiloh, Ellerslie, Murrays Crossroads and F.d. Roosevelt State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Chattahoochee; Harris; Marion; Meriwether; Muscogee; Schley; Talbot; Taylor; Troup; Webster
